intro: Campylospermum baronii, commonly known as the Baron's campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
